description: ***CORRECTED ORDER FOR SANCTIONS ENTERED AT 48 *** ORDER DENYING 42 Defendants' Motion for Sanctions. ORDER FOR SANCTIONS: Although Rule 11 sanctions are not warranted, there remains the question of whether the Court, pursuant to its show cause order, should sanction each party...Accordingly, the Court finds that sanctions are necessary and appropriate. For DePalma, Kerns, and Adamo, How Did America Get So Mean is now a must read. Each shall obtain the article by proper means, study it carefully, and write a paper examining and critiquing Mr. Brooks's thesis and the grounds for that thesis. Each shall sign her paper and by her signature affirm, under penalty of perjury, that she alone, without the aid of outside intelligence, artificial or otherwise, prepared the paper. The paper shall consist of no fewer than 2,000 words. The parties need not agree with Mr. Brooks's thesis. But the parties should bear in mind that the Court shall review their work to determine whether the Court's sanctions have had the desired remedial effect and, if not, whether further sanctions are necessary. Each file her paper ex parte no later than THIRTY (30) DAYS from the entry of this Order. Ordered by CHIEF DISTRICT JUDGE MARC T TREADWELL on 9/21/2023. (kat) Modified docket text to add corrected information on 9/25/2023 (ans). (Entered: 09/21/2023)

description: OPINION AND ORDER re: 41 MOTION to Dismiss partially the Amended Complaint. filed by Johnson & Johnson, Ethicon, Inc.. For the foregoing reasons, Defendants' motion to dismiss is GRANTED in part and DENIED in part. ChemImage's claims against J&J survive, at least for now, but its damages for the breach of contract claims, if proved, are limited to "(i) the agreed-upon $40 million termination fee, plus (ii) any damages that ChemImage can prove it would have incurred during the 120-day notice period from March 6 to July 4, 2023." Defs.' Mem. 16. Unless and until the Court orders otherwise, Defendants shall answer ChemImage's claims within two weeks of the date of this Opinion and Order. The Clerk of Court is directed to terminate ECF No. 41. SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Jesse M. Furman on 8/12/2024) (jca) (Entered: 08/12/2024)
